page.title: 05Illston - social affairs
page.content: The village has a hall at which various social activities take place. The Women's Institute hold its monthly meetings there. There are also adult education classes occasionally, such as dressmaking. Whist drives are a regular feature. People may hire the hall for their own use, i.e. birthday parites, ramblers refreshment centre, etc. A charge is levied for these hirings. The hall now boasts a fully equipped kitchen and toilet facilities. Illston has its own Parish Council and local people discuss matters affecting the village and its surroundings. Mr. Jack Nourish is the present Chairman. There is a small area set aside in the village which has swings for the children to play.
